tasks.title: Set Up Migration Discovery Script
tasks.description: Create a script to scan ui/features/* directories and identify all JS/JSX files importing InstUI packages, sorted by folder size (smallest first) for prioritized processing.
tasks.details:
Create a Python or Node.js script that:
1. Recursively scans each ui/features/* subdirectory
2. Identifies .js and .jsx files that import from @instructure/ui-* packages
3. Excludes test files (__tests__/, *.test.js, *.test.jsx, *.spec.js, *.spec.jsx)
4. Groups files by feature folder
5. Counts InstUI-importing files per folder
6. Outputs a sorted list (smallest to largest) with:
   - Feature folder path
   - File count
   - List of specific files to migrate
7. Save output to .taskmaster/docs/instui-migration-manifest.json

InstUI packages to detect:
- @instructure/ui-a11y-content
- @instructure/ui-alerts
- @instructure/ui-buttons
- @instructure/ui-color-utils
- @instructure/ui-dom-utils
- @instructure/ui-drilldown
- @instructure/ui-grid
- @instructure/ui-icons
- @instructure/ui-menu
- @instructure/ui-responsive
- @instructure/ui-simple-select
- @instructure/ui-spinner
- @instructure/ui-text
- @instructure/ui-text-input
- @instructure/ui-truncate-text
- @instructure/ui-view

Example output structure:
```json
{
  "generated": "2026-02-14",
  "totalFolders": 80,
  "totalFiles": 320,
  "folders": [
    {
      "path": "ui/features/canvas_career",
      "fileCount": 1,
      "files": ["index.jsx"],
      "status": "pending"
    }
  ]
}
```
tasks.testStrategy: Run the script and verify output contains all 234 feature folders. Cross-reference with manual grep searches to confirm file counts match. Ensure test files are properly excluded.

tasks.title: Create Migration Task Tracking System
tasks.description: Establish a tracking system to monitor the status of each feature folder migration through the complete workflow (GitHub PR → CI → Gerrit → Review → Merge).
tasks.details:
Extend the migration manifest JSON to track workflow state:

1. Add status fields to each folder entry:
   ```json
   {
     "path": "ui/features/example",
     "files": [...],
     "status": "pending",
     "githubPr": {
       "number": null,
       "url": null,
       "status": null,
       "ciStatus": null
     },
     "gerrit": {
       "changeId": null,
       "url": null,
       "status": null,
       "reviewers": []
     },
     "worktree": {
       "path": null,
       "branch": null
     },
     "migratedAt": null,
     "mergedAt": null
   }
   ```

2. Define status values:
   - pending: Not started
   - in_progress_migration: Converting files
   - in_progress_validation: Running eslint/biome/tsc
   - in_progress_ci: GitHub PR open, awaiting CI
   - in_progress_gerrit: Pushed to Gerrit
   - blocked: CI failing or review feedback needed
   - completed: Merged to Gerrit master

3. Create helper script to update status:
   - `update-migration-status.sh <folder> <status> [fields...]`

4. Create progress report generator showing:
   - Total folders / completed / in-progress / blocked
   - Estimated completion based on velocity
tasks.testStrategy: Create test entries with various statuses. Verify status updates persist correctly. Run progress report and confirm counts match actual state.

tasks.title: Document TypeScript Migration Patterns
tasks.description: Create a reference guide documenting common patterns for converting InstUI-importing files from JavaScript to TypeScript, including type definitions and @ts-expect-error usage.
tasks.testStrategy: Apply patterns to 2-3 test migrations. Verify converted files pass eslint, biome, and tsc. Document any additional patterns discovered.

tasks.title: Create Worktree Management Scripts
tasks.description: Develop helper scripts for managing git worktrees in ~/inst/canvas-lms for the Gerrit push workflow.
tasks.details:
Create scripts in .taskmaster/scripts/:

1. **create-worktree.sh <feature-name>**:
   ```bash
   #!/bin/bash
   FEATURE=$1
   BRANCH="ts-instui-$FEATURE"
   WORKTREE_BASE=~/inst/canvas-lms-worktrees
   
   cd ~/inst/canvas-lms
   wt switch --create $BRANCH -y
   
   # Copy .tool-versions for asdf
   cp ~/inst/canvas-lms/.tool-versions $WORKTREE_BASE/$BRANCH/
   
   echo "Worktree created: $WORKTREE_BASE/$BRANCH"
   ```

2. **apply-patch.sh <feature-name>**:
   ```bash
   #!/bin/bash
   FEATURE=$1
   BRANCH="ts-instui-$FEATURE"
   WORKTREE=$WORKTREE_BASE/$BRANCH
   
   # Generate patch from canvas-lms-readonly
   cd ~/inst/canvas-lms-readonly
   git diff HEAD~1 > /tmp/$FEATURE.patch
   
   # Apply to worktree
   cd $WORKTREE
   git apply -3 /tmp/$FEATURE.patch
   ```

3. **commit-and-push.sh <feature-name> <description>**:
   ```bash
   #!/bin/bash
   FEATURE=$1
   DESC=$2
   
   cd $WORKTREE
   git add -A
   git commit -m "$DESC
   
   refs CFA-436
   flag=none"
   
   ger push
   ```

4. **cleanup-worktree.sh <feature-name>**:
   ```bash
   #!/bin/bash
   FEATURE=$1
   BRANCH="ts-instui-$FEATURE"
   
   cd ~/inst/canvas-lms
   git worktree remove $WORKTREE_BASE/$BRANCH
   git branch -d $BRANCH
   ```
tasks.testStrategy: Test each script with a dummy branch name. Verify worktree creation, patch application, commit formatting, and cleanup all work correctly.

tasks.title: Create GitHub PR Template for Migrations
tasks.description: Create a standardized PR template for TypeScript migration PRs in the canvas-lms-readonly repository.
tasks.details:
Create .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE/typescript_migration.md:

```markdown
## TypeScript Migration: [Feature Name]

### Summary
Migrate InstUI-importing files in `ui/features/<feature>` from JavaScript to TypeScript.

### Files Changed
<!-- List files being converted -->
- [ ] `path/to/file1.jsx` → `path/to/file1.tsx`
- [ ] `path/to/file2.js` → `path/to/file2.ts`

### Migration Details
- **Feature folder**: `ui/features/<feature>`
- **Files migrated**: X
- **Type suppressions added**: Y

### Validation Checklist
- [ ] `yarn lint` passes
- [ ] `yarn check:biome` passes
- [ ] `npx tsc --noEmit` passes (entire codebase)
- [ ] No `as` type casts used
- [ ] No `any` types used
- [ ] @ts-expect-error comments include explanations

### Gerrit Tracking
- **Jira**: CFA-436
- **Gerrit Change-Id**: (to be added after push)
- **Gerrit URL**: (to be added after push)

### Notes
<!-- Any special considerations or known issues -->

---
*This PR will be closed automatically when pushed to Gerrit.*
```

Also create a script to auto-fill the template:
```bash
generate-pr-body.sh <feature-name> <files...>
```
tasks.testStrategy: Create a test PR using the template. Verify all sections render correctly on GitHub. Test the auto-fill script generates valid markdown.

tasks.title: Implement Validation Pipeline
tasks.description: Create a local validation script that runs all required checks (eslint, biome, tsc) before creating a PR.
tasks.details:
Create .taskmaster/scripts/validate-migration.sh:

```bash
#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "=== Running ESLint ==="
yarn lint
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
  echo "❌ ESLint failed"
  exit 1
fi
echo "✓ ESLint passed"

echo "=== Running Biome ==="
yarn check:biome
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
  echo "Attempting biome:fix..."
  yarn biome:fix
  yarn check:biome
  if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "❌ Biome failed after fix attempt"
    exit 1
  fi
fi
echo "✓ Biome passed"

echo "=== Running TypeScript Check ==="
echo "(This checks the entire codebase, may take a minute...)"
npx tsc --noEmit
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
  echo "❌ TypeScript check failed"
  exit 1
fi
echo "✓ TypeScript passed"

echo ""
echo "=================================="
echo "✅ All validations passed!"
echo "Ready to create PR."
echo "=================================="
```

Optionally create a watch mode for iterative development:
```bash
validate-migration-watch.sh
# Uses nodemon/chokidar to re-run on file changes
```
tasks.testStrategy: Run validation script on clean codebase (should pass). Introduce intentional errors (lint, type, biome) and verify each is caught. Test auto-fix functionality.

tasks.title: Migrate ui/features/canvas_career (1 file)
tasks.description: Convert the single InstUI-importing file in ui/features/canvas_career to TypeScript as a pilot migration.
tasks.details:
Files to migrate:
- ui/features/canvas_career/index.jsx → index.tsx

Steps:
1. Read the file and analyze InstUI imports
2. Rename .jsx to .tsx
3. Add type annotations to component props
4. Add types to event handlers and state
5. Use @ts-expect-error where types are complex
6. Run validation pipeline
7. Create PR in canvas-lms-readonly
8. Wait for CI to pass
9. Generate patch and apply to Gerrit worktree
10. Push to Gerrit with:
   ```
   chore: migrate ui/features/canvas_career to TypeScript
   
   Convert InstUI-importing files to TypeScript as part of
   the CFA-436 migration initiative.
   
   refs CFA-436
   flag=none
   ```
11. Find reviewers via /find-reviewers
12. Close GitHub PR
13. Update tracking manifest

This is the pilot migration - document any issues encountered for the migration guide.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify file compiles without errors. Run full validation pipeline. Confirm PR passes CI. Verify Gerrit push succeeds and reviewers are assigned.

tasks.title: Create Migration Progress Dashboard
tasks.description: Build a simple progress tracking dashboard that shows overall migration status, blocked items, and estimated completion.
tasks.details:
Create a dashboard script or web page that:

1. Reads .taskmaster/docs/instui-migration-manifest.json
2. Calculates statistics:
   - Total folders to migrate
   - Completed / In Progress / Blocked / Pending
   - Total files migrated vs remaining
   - Completion percentage

3. Shows breakdown by status:
   ```
   ============================================
   InstUI TypeScript Migration Progress
   ============================================
   
   Overall: 45/80 folders (56.25%)
   Files:   215/361 files (59.56%)
   
   Status Breakdown:
   ├── Completed:    45 folders
   ├── In Progress:   3 folders
   ├── Blocked:       2 folders
   └── Pending:      30 folders
   
   Blocked Items:
   ├── ui/features/foo - CI failing (lint errors)
   └── ui/features/bar - Review feedback pending
   
   Recent Activity:
   ├── ui/features/canvas_career - Merged 2h ago
   └── ui/features/dashboard - In review
   ```

4. Option to output as markdown for status updates
tasks.testStrategy: Run dashboard with test data at various states (empty, partial, complete). Verify counts are accurate. Test markdown output renders correctly.

tasks.title: Create CI Integration for Auto-Close PRs
tasks.description: Set up automation to automatically close GitHub PRs when the corresponding Gerrit change is successfully pushed.
tasks.details:
Options:

1. **GitHub Action workflow**:
   ```yaml
   name: Close PR on Gerrit Push
   on:
     workflow_dispatch:
       inputs:
         pr_number:
           description: 'PR number to close'
           required: true
         gerrit_url:
           description: 'Gerrit change URL'
           required: true
   
   jobs:
     close-pr:
       runs-on: ubuntu-latest
       steps:
         - uses: actions/github-script@v7
           with:
             script: |
               await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                 owner: context.repo.owner,
                 repo: context.repo.repo,
                 issue_number: ${{ inputs.pr_number }},
                 body: 'This PR has been pushed to Gerrit: ${{ inputs.gerrit_url }}\n\nClosing this PR.'
               });
               await github.rest.pulls.update({
                 owner: context.repo.owner,
                 repo: context.repo.repo,
                 pull_number: ${{ inputs.pr_number }},
                 state: 'closed'
               });
   ```

2. **CLI script using gh**:
   ```bash
   close-pr-after-gerrit.sh <pr_number> <gerrit_url>
   gh pr close $pr_number --comment "Pushed to Gerrit: $gerrit_url"
   ```

3. Integrate into the commit-and-push workflow
tasks.testStrategy: Test with a dummy PR. Verify PR is closed with correct comment. Verify idempotency (running twice doesn't error).

tasks.title: Document Lessons Learned and Update Migration Guide
tasks.description: After completing initial migrations, document patterns, gotchas, and update the migration guide with real-world examples.
tasks.details:
After completing tasks 7-20 (single-file migrations), review and document:

1. **Common Type Patterns**:
   - Event handler types that work
   - Props patterns that emerged
   - @ts-expect-error usage patterns

2. **Gotchas Discovered**:
   - Canvas-specific type issues
   - InstUI component edge cases
   - Build/lint issues encountered

3. **Workflow Improvements**:
   - Steps that could be automated
   - Common mistakes to avoid
   - Time estimates for different file counts

4. **Update migration guide** with:
   - Real code examples from completed migrations
   - Copy-paste patterns for common scenarios
   - Checklist of things to verify

5. **Create FAQ**:
   - Common CI failures and fixes
   - Gerrit review feedback patterns
   - Type error resolution strategies
tasks.testStrategy: Review guide with fresh eyes. Apply documented patterns to a new migration. Verify patterns work as documented.

tasks.title: Final Cleanup and Verification
tasks.description: Verify all migrations are complete, clean up tracking artifacts, and document final state.
tasks.details:
After all migrations complete:

1. **Verification**:
   - Re-run discovery script to confirm 0 remaining JS/JSX files with InstUI imports
   - Run full tsc --noEmit to verify no type errors
   - Run full lint suite

2. **Cleanup**:
   - Delete all worktrees
   - Archive tracking manifest
   - Close any stale PRs

3. **Documentation**:
   - Final count of files migrated
   - Total @ts-expect-error suppressions added
   - Time spent / lessons learned summary

4. **Jira Update**:
   - Comment on CFA-436 with completion summary
   - Link to final commit on Gerrit master

5. **Notify Team**:
   - Send summary to team channel
   - Highlight any files that need follow-up type work
tasks.testStrategy: Run discovery script and verify 0 remaining files. Run full validation suite. Verify all PRs are closed and worktrees deleted.
